title: Rhinanthus angustifolius
text:
Rhinanthus angustifolius, the narrow-leaved rattle or greater yellow-rattle, is a plant species of the genus "<a href="Rhinanthus">Rhinanthus</a>". It is an <a href="annual%20plant">annual</a> wildflower <a href="native%20plant">native</a> to temperate <a href="grassland">grassland</a>s in much of <a href="Europe">Europe</a>, and north and central Western <a href="Asia">Asia</a>. The yellow flowers are mostly visited by <a href="bumblebee">bumblebee</a>s.
